comment: Avar nus 'hundred' originates in the word nus 'knife' [saidova2008: 267].

Avar nus 'hundred' originates in the word nus 'knife' [saidova2008: 267].

This root in Hunzib and Bezhta is different than in other Tsezic languages. It has the meaning 'knife' just like the Avar word for 'hundred', nus [comrieetal2015: 561]. [desheriev1953: 189] also mentions the root /as/ 'hundred', borrowed from Georgian. According to this source, the native vigesimal derivation is mostly forgotten now and not replicated by youth.
